rules.name: accurateAzaleaLeafDistribution
rules.description: The distribution of azalea leaf types matches the azalea bush the tree is grown from
extras: These features are controlled through doormat/worldgen/configured_feature/azalea_tree_many_flowers.json and azalea_tree_no_flowers.json respectively.

rules.name: alwaysHalloween
rules.description: Mobs will always have a chance to wear carved pumpkins, regardless of the time of year
extras: This also affects bat spawning rates.

rules.name: azaleaLeavesGrowFlowers
rules.description: Azalea leaves grow flowers when fertilized

rules.name: barrelItemDumping
rules.description: Barrels facing down will eject all of their contained items when opened

rules.name: beaconsHealPets
rules.description: Beacons with their secondary effect set to regeneration can heal nearby tamed mobs

rules.name: chiseledBookshelfSignalBasis
rules.description: The thing comparators measure when outputting the signal strength of chiseled bookshelves
extras: "interaction" is vanilla behavior, and is equal to the last slot interacted with.
"fullness" depends on the number of books in the bookshelf.
Lerped interpolates from 1 to 15, instead of outputting the exact number.

rules.name: commandQC
rules.description: Enables /quasiconnectivity command to toggle quasi-power capability for individual redstone components
validators: It has an accompanying command
Can be limited to 'ops' only, true/false for everyone/no one, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandRandomTick
rules.description: Enables /randomtick command to forcibly send randomTicks to the specified block position
validators: It has an accompanying command
Can be limited to 'ops' only, true/false for everyone/no one, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandUpdateType
rules.description: Enables /updatetype command to change the updates individual redstone components emit when changing state
validators: It has an accompanying command
Can be limited to 'ops' only, true/false for everyone/no one, or a custom permission level

rules.name: compactEnchantTooltips
rules.description: Compacts the tooltips of enchantments by listing them as a cycling carousel
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!
validators: Its a client command so can be issued and potentially be effective when connecting to non-carpet/vanilla servers. In these situations (on vanilla servers) it will only affect the executing player, so each player needs to type it separately for the desired effect

rules.name: compactPotTooltips
rules.description: Compacts the tooltips of decorated pots by grouping like sherds together
extras: "ignore_bricks" removes bricks from the tooltips entirely.
For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!
validators: Its a client command so can be issued and potentially be effective when connecting to non-carpet/vanilla servers. In these situations (on vanilla servers) it will only affect the executing player, so each player needs to type it separately for the desired effect

rules.name: compactTemplateTooltips
rules.description: Compacts the tooltips of smithing templates by removing the "Applies to" and "Ingredients" text
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!
validators: Its a client command so can be issued and potentially be effective when connecting to non-carpet/vanilla servers. In these situations (on vanilla servers) it will only affect the executing player, so each player needs to type it separately for the desired effect

rules.name: compactTrimTooltips
rules.description: Compacts the tooltips of armor trims to a single line
extras: "only_pattern" removes the material text but leaves the color formatting.
For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!
validators: Its a client command so can be issued and potentially be effective when connecting to non-carpet/vanilla servers. In these situations (on vanilla servers) it will only affect the executing player, so each player needs to type it separately for the desired effect

rules.name: comparatorsReadThroughChains
rules.description: Comparators can read through chains, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: comparatorsReadThroughPaths
rules.description: Comparators can read through dirt paths, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: comparatorsReadThroughPistons
rules.description: Comparators can read through pistons, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: composterSideInputs
rules.description: Items can be inserted into composters from all 6 sides instead of just the top, via hoppers and droppers.

rules.name: consistentExplosionImmunity
rules.description: Explosion-immune blocks also apply this property to their dropped item counterparts
extras: Though marked as "Works As Intended", this rule technically fixes this bug: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-212764

rules.name: copperBulbDelay
rules.description: The length of time it takes for copper bulbs to react to a signal, in ticks
extras: 1 is the value that matches the behavior of 23w43a-23w45a.
validators: You must choose a value from 0 to 1200

rules.name: copperBulbOxidationSignal
rules.description: Comparators reading from copper bulbs output a signal strength based on the oxidation stage, instead of a binary output

rules.name: cryingObsidianPortalFrames
rules.description: Crying obsidian can be used in the frames of nether portals

rules.name: deepslateDungeons
rules.description: Dungeons that generate below y = 0 will be made of cobbled deepslate instead of cobblestone

rules.name: disableEndPortalCrossing
rules.description: Disables travelling through end portals

rules.name: disableNetherPortalCrossing
rules.description: Disables travelling through nether portals

rules.name: disablePetAttacking
rules.description: Disables players harming tamed mobs
extras: "owned" allows players to hit pets that aren't their own.

rules.name: disableShulkerReproduction
rules.description: Disables shulkers duplicating when hit by bullets
extras: Intended to be used in tandem with carpet's shulkerSpawningInEndCities.

rules.name: fastLeafDecay
rules.description: The chance per gametick of leaves decaying when their supporting logs are removed, in 1/x
extras: 0 restores vanilla randomTick behavior, and 0.075 is the value that matches the behavior of Vanilla Tweaks' datapack.
validators: Must be between 0 and 1

rules.name: fireAspectLighting
rules.description: Items enchanted with fire aspect can be used to light campfires, candles and TNT, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: forceGrassSpread
rules.description: Grass and mycelium can instantly spread to adjacent fertilized dirt
extras: This behaves the same as nylium in vanilla.

rules.name: growableSwampOakTrees
rules.description: Oak saplings grow into swamp oaks in swamp biomes

rules.name: hopperTransferTime
rules.description: The length of time it takes for a hopper to transfer an item, in ticks
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 1200

rules.name: huskWashing
rules.description: Adult husks drop 1-3 sand when converting into zombies

rules.name: incrediblySecretSetting
rules.description: §kblblblbllblblbblblblblblblbl§r :3

rules.name: insomniaDayCount
rules.description: The number of sleepless nights after which phantoms can spawn around the player
validators: Must be a positive number or 0

rules.name: jukeboxDiscProgressSignal
rules.description: Comparators reading from jukeboxes output a signal strength based on how much of the music disc has been played, instead of the disc index

rules.name: leavesNoCollision
rules.description: Disables the tangibility of leaves, making it easier to traverse areas with lots of trees

rules.name: maxMinecartSpeed
rules.description: The maximum speed minecarts can travel at in blocks per second
extras: Underwater max speed will always be half of this number.
validators: Must be a positive number or 0

rules.name: mossSpreadToCobblestone
rules.description: Moss can convert nearby cobblestone to mossy cobblestone when fertilized
extras: This feature is controlled through doormat/worldgen/configured_feature/mossy_cobblestone_patch.json.

rules.name: mossSpreadToStoneBricks
rules.description: Moss can convert nearby stone bricks to mossy stone bricks when fertilized
extras: This feature is controlled through doormat/worldgen/configured_feature/mossy_stone_bricks_patch.json.

rules.name: peacefulMonsterSpawning
rules.description: Hostile mobs can passively spawn in peaceful mode
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

rules.name: phantomMinSpawnAltitude
rules.description: The minimum y height the player needs to be standing at in order to spawn phantoms
validators: You must choose a value from -63 to 320

rules.name: pistonMovementTime
rules.description: The length of time it takes for a piston to fully extend or retract, in ticks
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 1200

rules.name: playersDropAllXp
rules.description: Players drop all of their XP on death instead of a capped amount

rules.name: portalForceTicking
rules.description: Nether portal blocks randomTick when lit, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: propagulePropagation
rules.description: Mangrove propagules actually propagate, falling from trees and planting themselves automatically

rules.name: ravagersStompPlants
rules.description: Ravagers can break plants, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: reachAroundBridging
rules.description: Blocks can be placed by aiming in front of the block you're standing on, like in Bedrock Edition
validators: Its a client command so can be issued and potentially be effective when connecting to non-carpet/vanilla servers. In these situations (on vanilla servers) it will only affect the executing player, so each player needs to type it separately for the desired effect

rules.name: redstoneOpensBarrels
rules.description: Powering barrels with redstone forces them open

rules.name: renewableCobwebs
rules.description: Cave spider spawners generate cobwebs between nearby solid faces each spawn cycle
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

rules.name: renewableGildedBlackstone
rules.description: Blackstone adjacent to underwater magma blocks slowly becomes gilded over time

rules.name: renewableSporeBlossoms
rules.description: Spore blossoms generate underneath fertilized moss blocks

rules.name: retroRepeaterDelay
rules.description: Repeaters have delays of 2, 4, 10 and 14 ticks respectively, like they did during development of beta 1.3

rules.name: softInversion
rules.description: Redstone torches placed on the sides of pistons deactivate when the piston extends, like in Bedrock Edition

rules.name: solidEntityCollision
rules.description: Living entities can be collided with like boats

rules.name: sporeBlossomDuplication
rules.description: Spore blossoms drop themselves when fertilized, the same way tall flowers do

rules.name: stickyPillarBlocks
rules.description: Pillar blocks like logs and bone blocks stick to each other based on the axis direction when moved
extras: "stick_to_all" causes them to connect to each other regardless of axis direction.

rules.name: stickyStickyPistons
rules.description: Sticky pistons act like directional slime blocks
extras: "stick_to_all" causes them to stick omnidirectionally like normal slime blocks.

rules.name: thornyRoseBush
rules.description: Similarly to sweet berry bushes, rose bushes deal damage when you walk inside them
extras: This even has a unique death message!

rules.name: torchBurnoutFlickerAmount
rules.description: The number of times a redstone torch must flicker within the allocated timespan in order to burn out
validators: Must be a positive number or 0

rules.name: torchBurnoutTime
rules.description: The allocated time a torch has to reach its flicker count in order to burn out, in ticks
extras: 40 is the value that matches Bedrock Edition's behavior, assuming the default flicker amount value
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 1200

rules.name: trialSpawnerSheepActivation
rules.description: Sheep activate trial spawners instead of players

rules.name: zoglinsSpawnInPortals
rules.description: Zoglins have a chance of spawning inside overworld nether portals
